page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: CHURCH OF ST.MARY MAGDALENE,EAST KESWICK. FAMILY SERVICE 9.15a.m.AND 2nd SUNDAY EACH MONTH HOLY COMMUNION 9.15a.m.EVERY OTHER SUNDAY AT ALL HALLOWS,BARDSEY. WE VISITED EAST KESWICK CHURCH THROUGH THE LYCH GATE THAT WAS LIKE A PORCH.ON IT,IT SAID"IN MEMORY OF THE MEN OF THIS VILLAGE WHO GAVE THEIR LIVES FOR THEIR COUNTRY 1914-1919.LEST WE FORGET". ON THE WALLS INSIDE THE LYCH GATE WERE THE NAMES OF THE MEN MENTIONED ON THE OUTSIDE. INSIDE THE CHURCH WERE 22 PEWS MADE BY "THE MOUSEMAN-THOMPSONS OF KILBURN".MOST OF THE CHURCH FURNITURE INCLUDING THE ALTAR RAILS HAD MICE ON THEM.THERE WAS A STONE FONT,A BRASS EAGLE LECTERN,3 BELLS.THERE WERE MANY BEAUTIFUL STAINED GLASS WINDOWS.THE OLDEST GRAVESTONE WAS 1851.
